title: 109_hr5413
content: The Act aims to improve the codification of title 46, United States Code, by incorporating public comments and amendments made after the cutoff date of a previous bill. It specifically addresses personal injury or death of seamen. The Act focuses on amending laws related to personal injury or death of seamen under title 46, United States Code. It allows seamen or their representatives to bring actions for injury or death, similar to laws for railway employees, with the option of admiralty or jury trial. Venue for legal actions is determined by the employer's location. The Act amends title 46, United States Code, by redesignating paragraphs and defining terms like Administrator and Secretary. It also prioritizes certain vessels for guarantees under the Maritime Security Act of 2003. The Act amends title 46, United States Code, by prioritizing vessels for guarantees under the Maritime Security Act of 2003. It requires the Secretary of Defense to determine vessel eligibility for naval auxiliary service in times of war or national emergency within 30 days of a request from the Administrator. The Act amends title 46, United States Code, by prioritizing vessels for guarantees under the Maritime Security Act of 2003. It changes references from "Secretary" to "Administrator" and removes specific requirements for independent analysis conducted under subsection (d) of section 53708. The Act amends title 46, United States Code, by changing references from "Secretary" to "Administrator" and updating requirements for independent analysis conducted under subsection (d) of section 53708. Amendments also include provisions for additional payments, collateral, or equity contributions in loan agreements under section 53712(b) and modifications to subsections (c) and (d) of section 53717. The Act amends various provisions in title 46, United States Code, by replacing references to "Secretary" with "Administrator" and making adjustments to specific sections such as 53710, 53717, 53718, 53731, 53732, and 53733. Additionally, it updates language in section 53710 regarding the entity responsible for certain actions. The Act further amends sections in title 46, United States Code by replacing "Secretary" with "Administrator" in specific sections and inserting "or Administrator's" after "Secretary's" in certain provisions. SEC. 4. MISCELLANEOUS AMENDMENTS. Title 46, United States Code, is amended by changing "Naval Reserve" to "Navy Reserve" in chapters 513 and 515. Section 51504(f) is amended to specify fuel cost payments to State maritime academies, with maximum amounts set for each fiscal year. Section 51505(b)(2)(B) is also amended to adjust payment limits for State maritime academies. Section 51701(a) undergoes an unspecified amendment. Section 51701(a) is amended to include functions to assist the United States merchant marine as determined necessary by the Secretary. Section 51907 is amended to allow the Secretary of Transportation to provide decorations, medals, and replacements as authorized by the chapter. The new chapter 541 titled "Assistance for small shipyards and maritime communities" is inserted after chapter 539. Section 3506 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2006 is transferred and redesignated as section 54101 of title 46, United States Code. The heading of section 54101 is amended to reflect its new title. Section 54101(b) is amended by inserting "or" after paragraph (2), striking paragraph (3), and redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (3). Section 60301 is amended to adjust tonnage fees for fiscal years 2006 through 2010 and thereafter. The tonnage fees are adjusted to 6 cents per ton for fiscal years 2006 through 2010, and not to exceed 30 cents per ton per year thereafter. SEC. 5. REPEALS. The following provisions are repealed, except for rights, duties, penalties, or proceedings before the enactment of this Act.
